author: huths0lo
title: Grow Your Own Adventure Mobile
description: There exists a lack of easily accessible blockchain driven gaming products.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal claims to develop a "Grow your own Adventure Play2Earn product", where randomly generated NFT's are an integral part of the idea. However, it is hard for a reader to understand what they really are trying to achieve. The term product is consistently used but unfortunately this brings more confusion than clarity. For a reader, it seems that there is only a vague connection between the proposal and gaming, therefore the term product is used instead. It is also not mentioned in the proposal what the "Grow your own Adventure Play2Earn product" really is. Is it a game, a CNFT collection platform, a general CNFT portfolio? The proposer should include more information and bring clarity to this distinction in order to receive a higher score in terms of impact. They succeed to address certain points within the challenge brief which raises the score given. All in all, a score of 3 stars is given.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers claims to be very experienced and have already developed a big part of their platform. From the available information the project seems feasible in terms of development and implementation. 
The budget is not broken down in any form, which makes it harder for the proposers to back up their claims that it is a reasonable amount of compensation. 
A potential risk is mentioned about wallet integration, it is good that the proposers acknowledge this as a risk and also provide a plan to action on how to solve it. This brings a bit more uncertainty to the feasibility but no deduction is made in the score. Their acknowledgement and expertise is deemed enough to make up for this. 
The feasibility is rated 4-stars, the budget should be more detailed as well as some kind of roadmap could be included to gain one more star.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability of the proposal is quiet poor. The proposers claim that only the developer of the handheld application will receive KIP's, and this is in the future some time. It is easy to believe that no KPI's have been decided yet. More transparency and a set of real KPI's would be favorable to increase the score in terms of auditability. 
Lastly, the success is defined as a launch on the Apple App store, this is a binary condition where no aspect in regards to quality or functionality have been accounted for. It is recommended to deliver more details in the auditability section overall. 
A score of 2-star is given since it is currently not possible to audit the proposal more than an app store launch.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal addresses the challenge as it aims to deliver a freely downloadable handheld application. 
However, vague details on the value proposition, game principles are given.
f6_assessments.q1: The minimum viable product for this proposal is expected to be delivered on April 20th this year, hence it cannot be evaluated. I don't find any reference to the team members profiles. According to the team the major risk for the play to earn game is the wallet connectivity, which is considered by a normal routine task by the other projects.
f6_assessments.q2:
Despite the KPIs for the challenge have been defined and the Github repository contains some of the game coded elements, there is no link to the actual game/website. Moreover, no budget breakdown and no clear timeline were provided. I really encourage the team to restructure the proposal by adding some more details.
How the game will be advertised ? 
How is the game structured ? 
Being part of a team with an already funded proposal (in a different challenge) does not mean that the following one should be funded as well.

f6_assessments.q0: There are several interesting concepts and proposed features in here, such as allowing inexperienced newbies to practice on the testnet before committing funds to the real deal.  This is a very good idea for "softening the blow" that a new person to crypto experiences when they are forced to endanger their wallet to learn.  This in itself could greatly encourage adoption, and safety of adoption for new people, if it is done effectively.
f6_assessments.q1: Team appears knowledgeable and experienced.  Has experience with the community and IT.  Is preparing to launch their own project soon.  Would like a little more information/detail on the $25,000 "Handheld Application Developer Contract."
f6_assessments.q2: "The handheld application developer will be given milestones, and KPI's to assure final delivery."  It would be MUCH better if you specified these in the proposal where you are asking for $25K please.

solution: Our solution is to create a freely downloadable handheld application, leveraging Testnet for free user onboarding to a Mainnet product.
experience: The Cardano Budz Team has over 45 years of collective IT Experience.  We specialize in Network Hardware, Server, and Application/Database Management.  We have proven our blockchain acumen through our Cardano Budz, and Cardano Lotto applications.
